text: Funny how back when I played the game, this theme went from being relaxing to giving me headaches. Some of the puzzles were really head scratching, but it was basically an entertaining way to play the Brain Age games. I actually haven't played any of the sequels, not for any specific reason other than having limited free time and too many games to play. Still, I consider having 100%'d this game an achievement!
author: SupraDarky

text: This game was really memorable for me. So much in fact, that when I replayed it last year, I remembered most of the solutions from my first time playing XD. If you ever have any time, the other games are worth checking out. Great puzzles and more great music.
author: GenericYoutubeComment Channel

Layton vs Phoenix weight it's an easy recommendation as well!

author: Bubbles, the monkey from DBZ

text: I recommend you definitely play any of the Layton sequels. This is a fantastic game and all, but the sequels managed to expand so much on the formula this game set. Whether it's more engrossing stories, more minigames and collectables, and unique ways to solve puzzles (including some that can be solved with the 3DS' gyroscope feature). Or in your case, the soundtracks, which are a HUGE improvement from this game. At the very least, check out the soundtracks of Unwound Future, Last Specter or MIracle Mask and I guarantee you your heart will melt at some of the tunes.
author: Medal Melodies

text: That being said though, maybe skip Diabolical Box. It's... not very good. Soundtrack is very nice though.
author: Medal Melodies

text: The main theme to unwound future is one of my favourites of all time. Used to listen to it on loop through the game's music player haha

text: You're right, I think they are not available anymore, which stinks.
author: NSXTypeRGTRLM

text:
Kind of, but not completely...

Basically, a few people are running backup servers for nintendo ds. Accessing them is rather simple in some cases (https://youtu.be/Sh0AZR-tKwM), and I believe they allow you to download DLC for multiple ds games (dragon quest, professor layton...). The biggest hurdle you will face will be finding a hotspot compatible with your ds, I think.
Of course, the method I link doesn't need you to hack your ds/3ds, but just change a few settings and the dns.
author: Deadkat
